Class Room

  • java.lang.Object
    • Room
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IRoom

    public class Room
extends java.lang.Object
implements IRoom
    A 15 x 15 grid full of portals (2 to 4), items (screws, gears, etc), the rover, and also the ship if it is the base room.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Room

        public Room()
        Create the starting room that is 15x15. Put 4 portals on the grid and the rover. Adds the broken ship parts to the center of the grid. and some random items at random locations.

      • Room

        public Room(Portal connection)
        Create a new room with a connection to the given parent room at the given portal coordinates for the parent room
        Parameters:
        connection - is the connecting portal in the parent room

        checks if point on grid is occupied
        Parameters:
        location - to check if grid point is occupied
        Returns:
        boolean value of false if grid point is null and otherwise returns true

      • getItem

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getImage

        public java.awt.Image getImage(int i,
                               int j)
        Return the image of the item in the grid at this location. Assumes that the location is occupied. If the location is not occupied, this will throw a null pointer exception. If something is wrong with the image, it may be null.
        Specified by:
        getImage in interface IRoom

      • isShip

        public boolean isShip(int width,
                      int height)
        Similar to other isShip method but uses x, y coordinates instead of a point location
        Parameters:
        width - coordinate
        height - coordinate
        Returns:
        boolean true if it is a ship, otherwise false by creating a new point and calling other isShip method with point location parameter

      • getItem

        Parameters:

        height - coordinate
        Returns:
